title: 17 Times We Indians Proved We're The Funniest People In The World
text:
17 Times We Indians Proved We're The Funniest People In The World

17 Times We Indians Proved We're The Funniest People In The World

Growing up in desi household you'll know how Indians can be the most savage, crazy and funny people. They have a whole range of reasons, too, for being the way they are. Whether it's getting pissed at traffic or losing it over what someone said that one time, there's one thing they never forget to be: genuinely hilarious.

If you look at social media closely, there are many examples of the same:

1.

So what's the distance of that place from your house ?

Others - It's about 500-550 meters.

Indians - Arey jyada nahi hai, bas 2-3 minute ka rasta hai

😅😅#JustIndianThings — Dreamy Eyed Idealist♡ (@khhwaAISH) September 26, 2019

2.

Now a days kids were talk in English

Aur humara bachpan toh,

"I beg to say that" bolne me nikal gaya😂😤#justindianthings — memer_wala_bhai (@memer_wala_bhai) May 12, 2019

3.

I am an Indian auto rickshaw driver. I use my leg to show my intention to turn left or right. #JustIndianThings pic.twitter.com/gkmQtqYTHa — Saloni (@Saloni_inolaS) March 13, 2019

4.

You know something's not right, when there are no "good morning " or "JSK" messages in the family Whatsapp group. #justIndianThings — chinky C (@balls_i_crush) June 27, 2019

Don't Miss 118 SHARES 3.9 K SHARES 134 SHARES 106 SHARES

5.

She: I like people who bathe daily!

He: Jo bhi ho, aaj to nahi naha raha..

Badalo ki respect important hai!#heshestories #justindianthings@Zakirism — Apoorv Agarwal (@TheChutneyboy) February 20, 2019

6.

Indian dad: “Say those 3 magical words”

Indian mom: “Motor khol do” #JustIndianThings — Abhijeet Bhatt (@BhattWhy) March 16, 2019

7.

In America

" John, say hello to guests "

" Please have a seat "

In Punjab

" Oh Pencho kithe aage "

" Samose le aaaa "

" Nach ke dikha uncle nu#Punjabis#justindianthings — Hemant_💚 (@mfl_hemant) September 28, 2019

8.

𝐏𝐞𝐨𝐩𝐥𝐞 𝐢𝐧 𝐈𝐧𝐝𝐢𝐚:

People: What have you done?

Me : I built a $10M business which I started with $700.

People: Yea, that's fine, but what degree do you have?

Me: Die crying 😭#Entrepreneurs #Entrepreneurship #India #JustIndianThings — Sayed Waquas Hassan (@sayedwaquas77) October 3, 2019

9.

In india trains are not called by their names, they are called by 8 baje wali, 9 baje wali , 10 baje wali 😂😂#indianthings — Chai~Suttaa (@chai_suttaa_) September 2, 2017

10.

What other people believes in -

"Love at first sight".

What Indian societies believe in-

"Judge at first sight".#indianthings — Hardik Gupta (@hardik_gupta_) October 2, 2018

11.

Indian family loves and care for

eachother in every moment.

"Bimar yek hota hai kichdi pura

khandan khata hai" #indianthings

😂 — Sagaar4 (@4Sagaar) October 5, 2019

12.

Struggling with a math q. Decides to have a badam (almond) so that the ans will pop into my head. 😆#indianthings — Ayman (@aymankanji) March 15, 2013

13.

that brilliant feeling when you can feel winters coming and diwali in the air. #indianthings — Shefali Deshpande (@shefaaaliD) October 28, 2012

14.

Facebook has become like that wedding function at which you can't drink because all the family elders are there — Rohan (@mojorojo) June 26, 2015

15.

Me: Marine Drive chalega?

Friend: Haan. Shraddha se puch.

Me: Jai Mata Di Marine Drive chalega? — Anurag Verma (@kitAnurag) April 4, 2014

16.

Beti Bachao Beti Padhao

Beti Ko Joke Sunao Beti LMAO — Avinash Iyer (@IyerAvin) June 29, 2015

17.
description: A world a strange place and we Indians are no less. Growing up in desi household you'll know how Indians are the most savage, crazy and funniest of all. They have the whole set of reasons of getting pissed or angry or even you'd never know what makes them laugh. If you look at social media closely, there are many examples of the same.
